block.p: Meghan Ann Mara, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wellington T. Mara of Rye, N.Y., was married there on Friday to Charles Rogers Brennan, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Brennan Jr. of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. The Rev. John E. McCarthy performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection.

Mrs. Brennan, 28, was until this month a teacher at the Ridgeway Nursery School in White Plains and a coach of field hockey and lacrosse at the Convent of the Sacred Heart, a prep school in Greenwich, Conn. She graduated from William Smith College and received a master's degree in elementary education from Fordham University. Her father is the president and an owner of the New York Giants football team, which was founded by his father, Timothy J. Mara.

Meghan Ann Mara, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wellington T. Mara of Rye, N.Y., was married there on Friday to Charles Rogers Brennan, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Brennan Jr. of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. The Rev. John E. McCarthy performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection.

Mrs. Brennan, 28, was until this month a teacher at the Ridgeway Nursery School in White Plains and a coach of field hockey and lacrosse at the Convent of the Sacred Heart, a prep school in Greenwich, Conn. She graduated from William Smith College and received a master's degree in elementary education from Fordham University. Her father is the president and an owner of the New York Giants football team, which was founded by his father, Timothy J. Mara.

Mr. Brennan, 30, is a bond salesman in Cleveland for McDonald Investments. He graduated from Boston College. His father is the founder and president of Brennan Development, a construction company in Troy, Mich.
